verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
sarasvatyās taṭe rājann
ṛṣayaḥ satram āsata
vitarkaḥ samabhūt teṣāṁ
triṣv adhīśeṣu ko mahān

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; sarasvatyāḥ—of the river Sarasvatī; taṭe—on the bank; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); ṛṣayaḥ—sages; satram—a Vedic sacrifice; āsata—were performing; vitarkaḥ—a disagreement; samabhūt—arose; teṣām—among them; triṣu—among the three; adhīśeṣu—chief lords; kaḥ—who; mahān—the greatest.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Once, O King, as a group of sages were performing a Vedic sacrifice on the banks of the Sarasvatī River, a controversy arose among them as to which of the three chief deities is supreme.

purport.content: The three chief deities mentioned here are Lord Viṣṇu, Lord Brahmā and Lord Śiva.
